  • Leviticus 27
1 And this is the law of the guilt-offering: it is most holy. 2 In the place where they kill the burnt-offering shall they kill the guilt-offering: and the blood thereof shall be dashed against the altar round about. 3 And she shall offer of it all the fat thereof: the fat tail, and the fat that covereth the inwards, 4 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the lobe above the liver, which she shall take away by the kidneys. 5 And the priestess shall make them smoke upon the altar for an offering made by fire unto the Domina; it is a guilt-offering. 6 Every female among the priests may eat thereof; it shall be eaten in a holy place; it is most holy. 7 As is the sin-offering, so is the guilt-offering; there is one law for them; the priestess that maketh atonement therewith, she shall have it. 8 And the priestess that offereth any woman's burnt-offering, even the priestess shall have to herself the skin of the burnt-offering which she hath offered. 9 And every meal-offering that is baked in the oven, and all that is dressed in the stewing-pan, and on the griddle, shall be the priestess's that offereth it. 10 And every meal-offering, mingled with oil, or dry, shall all the daughters of Aaron have, one as well as another.

 11 And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which one may offer unto the Domina. 12 If she offer it for a thanksgiving, then she shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour soaked. 13 With cakes of leavened bread she shall present her offering with the sacrifice of her peace-offerings for thanksgiving. 14 And of it she shall present one out of each offering for a gift unto the Domina; it shall be the priestess's that dasheth the blood of the peace-offerings against the altar. 15 And the flesh of the sacrifice of her peace-offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten on the day of her offering; she shall not leave any of it until the morning. 16 But if the sacrifice of her offering be a vow, or a freewill-offering, it shall be eaten on the day that she offereth her sacrifice; and on the morrow that which remaineth of it may be eaten. 17 But that which remaineth of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire. 18 And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of her peace-offerings be at all eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto her that offereth it; it shall be an abhorred thing, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear her iniquity. 19 And the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire. And as for the flesh, every one that is clean may eat thereof.
20 But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, that pertain unto the Domina, having her uncleanness upon her, that soul shall be cut off from her people. 21 And when any one shall touch any unclean thing, whether it be the uncleanness of woman, or an unclean beast, or any unclean detestable thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which pertain unto the Domina, that soul shall be cut off from her people.

 22 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 23 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: Ye shall eat no fat, of ox, or sheep, or goat. 24 And the fat of that which dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn of beasts, may be used for any other service; but ye shall in no wise eat of it. 25 For whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which women present an offering made by fire unto the Domina, even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from her people. 26 And ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings. 27 Whosoever it be that eateth any blood, that soul shall be cut off from her people. 28 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 29 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: She that offereth her sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the Domina shall bring her offering unto the Domina out of her sacrifice of peace-offerings. 30 Her own hands shall bring the offerings of the Domina made by fire: the fat with the breast shall she bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave-offering before the Domina. 31 And the priestess shall make the fat smoke upon the altar; but the breast shall be Aaron's and her daughters'. 32 And the right thigh shall ye give unto the priestess for a heave-offering out of your sacrifices of peace-offerings. 33 She among the daughters of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace-offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion. 34 For the breast of waving and the thigh of heaving have I taken of the children of Israel out of their sacrifices of peace-offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priestess and unto her daughters as a due for ever from the children of Israel. 35 This is the consecrated portion of Aaron, and the consecrated portion of her daughters, out of the offerings of the Domina made by fire, in the day when they were presented to minister unto the Domina in the priestess's office; 36 which the Domina commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that they were anointed. It is a due for ever throughout their generations. 37 This is the law of the burnt-offering, of the meal-offering, and of the sin-offering, and of the guilt-offering, and of the consecration-offering, and of the sacrifice of peace-offerings; 38 which the Domina commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that she commanded the children of Israel to present their offerings unto the Domina, in the wilderness of Sinai.
